Constructor Detail

Hotel

public Hotel(java.lang.String name)

Hotel

public Hotel(java.lang.String name,
             int[] rooms,
             double[] costPerNight)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a hotel object by input of the amount of rooms of each category and the prize of each category

Parameters:
name - the name of the hotel
rooms[] - the amount of rooms as an array - room[0]=5 would mean 5 one person rooms, room[1]=7 seven two person rooms and so on.
costPerNight[] - the cost per hotel category, has to be equal to the amount of room categories as defined by the room array
hotelID - the hotel ID. If left blank, ID will be assigned during SQL save
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - will check input and throws IllegalArgument exception on wrong arguments. Check exception text for more detail.

Creates a hotel object by input of the amount of rooms of each category and the prize of each category

Parameters:
name - the name of the hotel
rooms[] - the amount of rooms as an array - room[0]=5 would mean 5 one person rooms, room[1]=7 seven two person rooms and so on.
costPerNight[] - the cost per hotel category, has to be equal to the amount of room categories as defined by the room array
hotelID - the hotel ID. If left blank, ID will be assigned during SQL save
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - will check input and throws IllegalArgument exception on wrong arguments. Check exception text for more detail.

Hotel

public Hotel(java.lang.String name,
             java.util.ArrayList<Room> roomList,
             long hotelID)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Construct hotel, when Array of rooms is already known

Parameters:
name - the name of the hotel
roomList - the ArrayList of all rooms of the hotel
hotelID - the hotelID of the room
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - will check arguments and throw exception if arguments are not correct. See exception messages for more details.
